title: Railway Station Masters temporarily call off strike
byline: Railway Station Masters have decided to temporarily call off their strike action from midnight today (October 30).

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says the atmospheric conditions are getting favorable for afternoon thundershowers in most parts of the island for the next few days starting from today (31).

title: Spain battles deadliest flood disaster in decades as death toll rises to 95
byline: Spain is enduring its worst flooding disaster in decades, with at least 95 people dead and dozens more missing, after huge rains swept the eastern province of Valencia and beyond.

title: President’s message on 2024 Diwali Festival
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his message for the 2024 Diwali Festival, says that Hindu devotees globally celebrate Diwali with deep reverence, marking the victory of light over darkness.

title: Accomplices of ‘Army Chooty’ arrested with drugs worth over Rs. 285 mln
byline: The Police Special Task Force (STF) has arrested two accomplices of the underworld figure known as “Army Chooty,” who is responsible for managing the drug operations of Nandun Chintaka Wickremaratne, also known as ‘Harak Kata’.

title: Decline in coconut production expected to last until April 2025
byline: The Coconut Research Institute says that the decline in coconut production in the country is expected to persist until April of next year (2025).

title: 52-Year-old woman attacked to death with sharp weapon in Wariyapola
byline: A 52-year-old woman has died following a violent altercation involving a neighbour armed with a sharp weapon in the Wagolla area of Wariyapola.

title: No housing for Ministers in Colombo - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that the government’s primary focus will be on eradicating rural poverty, stating that effective governance demands proximity to the people.

title: PM discusses foreign employment and investment with Italian Ambassador
byline: Ambassador of Italy to Sri Lanka Damiano Francovigh has met with Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at the Prime Minister’s Office on Wednesday (30).

title: Maldivian President to visit Sri Lanka soon - envoy
byline: A meeting between Secretary to the President Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake and High Commissioner of Maldives to Sri Lanka Masood Imad held at the Presidential Secretariat, on Wednesday (30).

title: TikTok’s founder becomes China’s new richest person
byline: China has a new richest person – and it’s the entrepreneur behind the wildly popular, and controversial, app TikTok.

title: Two unidentified bodies found in Bogawantalawa and Peliyagoda
byline: Two unidentified bodies have been found in separate incidents in the Bogawantalawa and Peliyagoda police divisions, the police said.

title: Enter Air commences flight services between Poland and Sri Lanka
byline: Enter Air, the largest private airline operating in Poland has commenced flight services from Poland’s Warsaw to Colombo, marking the start of a new series of charter connections between Poland and Sri Lanka.

title: Ranil speaks out against revoking privileges of former Presidents
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe stresses that the privileges granted to former Presidents of the country should remain intact.

title: China’s BYD overtakes Tesla revenue for first time
byline: The Chinese electric vehicle giant BYD has seen its quarterly revenues soar, beating Tesla’s for the first time.

title: China to provide emergency humanitarian aid worth Rs. 400M to Sri Lanka
byline: The Chinese Government has decided to further provide a batch of Emergency Humanitarian Materials worth Rs. 400 million to Sri Lanka, the Chinese Embassy in Colombo said.

title: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte arrested
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte has been arrested by police this afternoon (31).

title: 40kg of heroin worth over Rs. 1Bn recovered in Sevanagala
byline: A stock of 40 kilograms of heroin estimated to be worth around Rs. 1,000 million has been recovered during a raid carried out by Police Special Task Force (STF) in the Sevanagala area.

title: Transparency and governance reforms key to attracting manufacturers to Sri Lanka - US Ambassador
byline: The United States Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung states that if the new government can strengthen the investment climate, implement anti-corruption measures, and strengthen business-friendly governance and transparency, there is potential for attracting more international manufacturers to invest in the country.

title: Dilith Jayaweera vows to build a strong opposition to ‘challenge and change’ existing system
byline: Leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance and Gampaha District parliamentary candidate, entrepreneur Dilith Jayaweera urged the public to vote for ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ to establish a strong opposition capable of challenging and changing the existing system.

title: Special measles vaccination program next week
byline: The Ministry of Health has announced a special measles vaccination program to be conducted from November 4 to 9.

title: Use of smoke-emitting firecrackers renews air pollution debate in India’s capital ahead of Diwali
byline: As India gears up for Diwali, the Hindu festival of lights, people are divided over whether they should celebrate by setting off firecrackers, which worsen the country’s chronic air pollution.

title: Lohan Ratwatte brought to Mirihana police
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte, who was arrested in Kandy today (31), has been brought to the Mirihana Police Station.

title: 7 injured in accident near Galle Face
byline: Seven individuals have been injured and hospitalized after a three-wheeler collided with a motorcycle and a car near the Galle Face Green in Colombo this afternoon (31).

title: PM vows to summon ex-President Ranil to provide evidence on ‘bond scam’
byline: Sri Lanka’s Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya assures that former President Ranil Wickremesinghe will be summoned to provide evidence regarding the Central Bank bond scam in 2015.

title: Lohan Ratwatte produced before Magistrate
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte, who was today arrested by the Mirihana Police, was produced before the Nugegoda Acting Magistrate this evening (31).

title: Fuel prices reduced
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has announced a revision of fuel prices effective from midnight today (31).

title: Former state minister Lohan Ratwatte remanded
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte, who was arrested by Mirihana Police in Kandy, has been remanded until November 07 by the Nugegoda Additional Magistrate.
